page.title: 19FUTURE DEVELOPMENTS,FAIR OAK
page.content: The original Fair Oak, a village of mainly small Victorian and Edwardian houses, a pub and a church and a few shops has been surrounded during the past thirty years by many building estates. These ,in many cases are of detached and semi-detached homes, an assortment of houses and bungalows. Several blocks of apartments for the elderly have been built. There are some rented council houses but most are owner occupied. Land is scarce and there are cases of old houses with large gardens being demolished to give way to as many as a dozen new homes. The area is in commuting distance from London and other large centres which has led to a large 'floating' population. Increased housing has led to problems with traffic.
